body.body: Euthanize adult mice \(C57bl/6 strain) by CO<sub>2</sub> and embed globes in cryomolds containing Tissue-Tek OCT compound and frozen on dry ice.
Cut frozen sections \(10 µm thickness) with a Leica 3060S cryostat and collect on SuperFrost/ Plus slides and store at -70°C.
Prior to immunolabeling, allow slides to air dry under vacuum for 20 minutes.
Fix sections for 10 minutes in 4% formaldehyde in 1X PBS, wash repeatedly in 1X PBS, prior to blocking in 5% normal goat serum in immunolabeling buffer
For paraffin embedded sections fix eyes in 10% Formalin \(overnight)
Embed globe in paraffin and cut 5μm sections with a microtome

Paraffinize sections used for antibody staining as follows: 


- Incubate in xylene for 3 minutes each \(3X). 


- Incubate in 100% ethanol for 2 minutes \(2X). 


- Hydrate by placing slide in 95% ethanol for 2 minutes \(2X) 


- Then 70% ethanol for 2 minutes \(2X)


- Then 50% ethanol for 2 minutes \(2X)


- Then 30% ethanol for 2 minutes \(2X)


- Transfer sections to distilled water.
Block with normal rabbit serum for 1 hr.
Dilute rabbit polyclonal antibody to IL-27 to 5 and 10µg/ml in immunolabeling buffer \(stock antibody =500ug/ml/ working dilutions of 1:50 and 1:100).
Incubate sections in diluted primary antibody overnight at 4°C in a humidified chamber.
Then incubate in Alexa 568 conjugated goat anti-rabbit secondary antibody containing DAPI \(1µg/ml) for 1hr at room temperature in an opaque chamber.
Then mount in anti-fading agent and cover with cover-slip. Primary antibody was omitted from sections used as negative controls.
Examine sections on a Leica SP2 laser scanning confocal microscope
All images were collected under identical PMT detector settings.
